author: arizfaiyaz
message: feat(curriculum): Add interactive examples to id selectors lesson (#62797)

files.patch:
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ challengeType: 19 dashedName: what-is-the-specificity-for-id-selectors --- -# --description-- +# --interactive-- ID selectors are among the most powerful selectors in CSS, allowing developers to apply styles to specific elements with unique identifiers. @@ -15,12 +15,23 @@ ID selectors are defined by a hash symbol (`#`) followed by the ID name. They sh Here is an example using an ID selector: +:::interactive_editor + +```html + +

Example paragraph

+

Another paragraph

+

Yet another paragraph

+``` + ```css #unique { color: purple; } ``` +::: + In this example, the element with the ID `unique` will have its text color set to `purple`. ID selectors have a very high specificity, higher than type selectors and class selectors, but lower than inline styles. The specificity value for an ID selector is `(0, 1, 0, 0)`.
